result.execSummary:
The defendant Mark L. Moore was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Mark L. Moore is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Mark L. Moore was found guilty of Attempt (Child Enticement) Child Enticement-Expose Genitals/Pubic Area/Intimate Parts, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.07(3).
  • Mark L. Moore was found guilty of Exposing Genitals/Pubic Area/Intimate Parts to a Child, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.10(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
2:37 p.m. Defendant Mark L. Moore in court with attorney Brian F. Bennett.  Defendant Mark L. Moore in custody.  Mary Margaret Sowinski appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Sowinski statement on sentencing. Victim will be testifying - Bennett request to hearing victim's statement in Chambers due to media presence. Sowinski states that media representative has assured that victim's identity will remain anonymous. Victim statement - Sowinski further statement on sentencing. Bennett/Court statement on sentencing. 
Court Sentence
Count 3
Prison - 12 years
Initial Confinement - 4 years
Extended Supervision - 8 years
CC/DNA Surcharge/Supervision Fees

Count 4 - CC
Prison - 3-1/2 years
Initial Confinement - 18 months
Extended Supervision - 2 years
CC/Supervision Fees

Jail credit - 412 days
Condition of extended supervision - Sex Offender Registry for life. Court costs both counts to be paid as a condition of extended supervision

Appeal rights given. NADVI given.  WEDS given.
Adj. 3:08 p.m.

1:38 p.m. Defendant Mark L. Moore in court with attorney Brian F. Bennett.  Defendant Mark L. Moore in custody.  Mary Margaret Sowinski appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 15cf267 and 15fo1085. Sowinski/Bennett state agreement. Court/Bennett statements to amendment of Count 3. State moves to dismiss Count 1 - Granted. State moves to dismiss but read-in Counts 2 and 5 - Granted. State moves to amend Count 3 to attempted child enticement, a Class D Felony, a violation of 948.07 - Granted. Defendant enters Alford plea to Count 3. Plea questionnaire filed. Defendant enters guilty plea to Count 4. Bennett statement to Alford plea.   Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists, accepts Alford and guilty pleas and finds defendant guilty. No PSI is anticipated. Bail is revoked. Adj. 1:53 p.m.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 21, 2016 at 02:30 pm.

1:23 p.m. Defendant Mark L. Moore in court, in custody, with attorney Brian F. Bennett. Mary Margaret Sowinski, Asst. DA, appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court statement. Sowinski statement--close to resolution. Bennett statement--agrees w/State's position. Bond continued.  Plea hearing scheduled for November 15, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
requesting extension to motion deadlines
Jury trial on November 7, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Jury trial on September 26, 2016 at 08:30 am.

11:35 a.m. Defendant Mark L. Moore in court, in custody, with attorney Brian F. Bennett.  Mary Margaret Sowinski, Asst. DA, appeared for the State of Wisconsin along with DA intern, Eric Klemm, under the student practice rule. Bennett statement--has requested jury trial; leave to have other reports in by 8/26/16; motions in limine by 9/16/16. Bond continued.  Jury trial scheduled for September 26, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Mark L. Moore in court with attorney Brian F. Bennett.  Defendant Mark L. Moore in custody.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
9:40
Court statement to status of case - Court has received copy of Dr. Galli's report - Bennett request leave to seek own Independant Evaluation - Schiek statement - Court will allow Defense to do own evaluation - disruption in court and parties asked to leave courtroom and security had to intervene. 
Bail continued  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 14, 2016 at 11:30 am.

11:23 a.m. Defendant Mark L. Moore in court with attorney Brian F. Bennett.  Defendant Mark L. Moore in custody.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Bennett statement that report of examination of defendant has not been completed. Requests adjournment. Bennett will contact Dr. Galli and advise of new date. Bail continued. Adj. 11:26 a.m.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 29, 2016 at 09:30 am.
copy of Order for exam mailed to examiner and defense attorney
for Examination under 971.16

11:08 a.m. Defendant Mark L. Moore in court with attorney Brian F. Bennett.  Defendant Mark L. Moore in custody.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Bennett - not prepared for resolution or jury trial. Bennett changes plea to Not Guilty by Reason of Mental Disease or Defect  - Court grants leave to change plea pursuant 971.16(2) and appoints Wisconsin Forensic Unit to appoint examiner. Bennett motion for modification of bond. Bednar statement to motion. Court denies motion to modify bond. Adj. 11:12 a.m.  Status conference scheduled for April 19, 2016 at 11:30 am.
States Reply to Discovery  and State's Demand for Discovery  - includes cover letter
- includes cover letter

3:34 p.m. Defendant Mark L. Moore in court via video with attorney Brian F. Bennett.  Defendant Mark L. Moore in custody.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Bennet - in receipt of Information - waive further reading - enters not guilty pleas to all counts - Bennett motion to modify bond - Schiek statement to bond - Court statement to bond - retains bond as is - Bail continued. Adj. 3:38 p.m.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 23, 2016 at 11:00 am.

3:58 pm Defendant Mark L. Moore in court with attorney Brian F. Bennett.  Defendant Mark L. Moore in custody.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 15cf267 and 15fo1085. State calls Oneida County Detective Sgt. Chad Wanta called/sworn/direct by Michlig/ Witness ID's defendant/ cross by Bennett / Court finds probable cause exists and binds defendant over. Bennett motion to modify bond - Michlig statement to bond - Court statement to bond - Court takes motion under advisement as defendant is currently on probation hold; if status with DOC changes Bennett may bring motion to modify before Court. Adj. 4:13 p.m.  Arraignment scheduled for December 28, 2015 at 03:30 pm.

2:45 p.m. Defendant Mark L. Moore in court with attorney Brian F. Bennett.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  In receipt of complaint, waive reading -set for preliminary hearing - time limits waived.
Bail continued. Adj. 2:47 p.m.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for December 17, 2015 at 03:30 pm.
No contact WHATSOEVER with ALW, d/o/b 2/21/05 - No contact WHATSOEVER of any kind with anyone under the age of 18. No possession of any sort of computer device; no connecting to internet.

1:56 p.m. Defendant Mark L. Moore in court, in custody.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   In receipt of complaint, right to counsel - defendant will seek counsel,  2:01 p.m. Off record
2:06 p.m. Bednar statement to bail - Court sets $25,000 cash bond. Adj. 2:11 p.m.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for November 30, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
